content.text: 1 The pictogram shows the number of goals scored by teams \(A, B\) and \(C\).
Key : represents 4 goals
(a) Work out the number of goals scored by team \(B\).
(b) Teams \(A, B, C\) and \(D\) scored a total of 43 goals.
Complete the pictogram.
2 An angle measures \(157^{\circ}\).
Write down the mathematical name for this type of angle.
3 Find the value of \(\sqrt{1.96}\).
4 Calculate the number of months in 5 years.
(a) Write down the order of rotational symmetry for this shape.
(b) Draw all the lines of symmetry on this shape.
6 In triangle \(A B C, A C=6.4 \mathrm{~cm}\) and \(B C=5.3 \mathrm{~cm}\).
Using a ruler and compasses only, construct triangle \(A B C\).
Leave in your construction arcs.
The line \(A B\) has been drawn for you.
7 Solve.
Find the value of \(T\) when \(P=12\).
Find the value of \(t\) when \(W=369\).
9 Represent the inequality \(-3<x \leqslant 2\) on the number line.
Write these numbers in order, starting with the smallest.
11 A plane leaves Seattle at 0730 on Tuesday and arrives in Seoul 10 hours and 55 minutes later.
The local time in Seoul is 16 hours ahead of the local time in Seattle.
Work out the day and time in Seoul when the plane arrives.
Day Time
12 The equation of line \(L\) is \(y=5 x-3\).
(a) Write down the gradient of line \(L\).
(b) Write down the equation of a line parallel to line \(L\).

\(
y=\ldots \ldots \ldots \ldots \ldots \ldots \ldots \ldots \ldots \ldots \ldots . . . \ldots \ldots . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .
\)
13 The scale drawing shows the position of ship \(A\).
The scale is 1 centimetre represents 50 kilometres.
Scale: 1 cm to 50 km
Ship \(B\) is 300 km from ship \(A\) on a bearing of \(105^{\circ}\).
On the scale drawing mark the position of ship \(B\).
14 Tom needs 225 g of flour to make 10 cakes.
A shop sells flour in 500 g bags.
Work out the number of bags of flour Tom needs to make 70 cakes.
Write down the letter of the graph that shows these lines.
16 The diagram shows a shape made from a square and four congruent isosceles triangles.
Work out the area of this shape.
17 The volume of a cylinder is \(863.5 \mathrm{~cm}^{3}\).
The height of the cylinder is 12.3 cm .
Find the radius of the cylinder.
cm
18 Dara changes 5700 Thai baht to dollars.
The exchange rate is \(\$ 1=34.18\) Thai baht.
Calculate the amount that Dara receives.
19 A four-sided dice is numbered 1 to 4.
Hrishi throws the dice 50 times.
The results are shown in the table.
Calculate the mean.
20 A tin contains red, yellow, green and brown sweets.
The table shows some of the probabilities of picking a sweet of each colour at random.
Complete the table.
21 The diagram shows a right－angled triangle \(A B C\) ．
Calculate \(B C\) ．
22 （a）Anil invests \(\$ 2000\) and Baz invests \(\$ 7500\) ．
Write the ratio money invested by Anil ：money invested by Baz in its simplest form．
（b）Kamil and Lavik share some money in the ratio Kamil ：Lavik＝5：9．
Lavik receives \(\$ 72\) more than Kamil．
Calculate the total amount of money they share．
（c）Vanisha invests \(\$ 4000\) for 5 years at a rate of \(3.5 \%\) per year compound interest．
Calculate the total interest earned during the 5 years．
23 The population of an island increases from 18400 to 19780.
Calculate the percentage increase.
Triangle \(A B C\) is mathematically similar to triangle \(U V W\).
Calculate \(A B\).
25 A bar of gold in the shape of a cuboid has dimensions 2 cm by 4 cm by 6.5 cm .
The density of gold is \(19.32 \mathrm{~g} / \mathrm{cm}^{3}\).
Calculate the mass of this bar of gold.
\(\left[\right.\) Density \(\left.=\frac{\text { mass }}{\text { volume }}\right]\)
26 Li asks 28 students if they speak English ( \(E\) ) and if they speak Spanish ( \(S\) ).
15 students speak English.
12 students speak Spanish.
6 do not speak English and do not speak Spanish.
(a) Complete the Venn diagram.
(b) Write down how many students speak English but do not speak Spanish.
(c) Find \(\mathrm{n}(E \cup S)\).
27 The height, \(h\) metres, of a building is 105 m , correct to the nearest metre.
Complete this statement about the value of \(h\).
\(\leqslant h<\)
28 (a) (i) Complete the table of values for \(y=x^{2}-x-5\).
(ii) On the grid, draw the graph of \(y=x^{2}-x-5\) for \(-3 \leqslant x \leqslant 4\).
(b) Write down the equation of the line of symmetry of the graph.
(c) Use the graph to solve the equation \(x^{2}-x-5=0\).
This shape is made from a rectangle and a semicircle.
The diameter of the semicircle is 10 cm .
Calculate the perimeter of this shape.
cm
The diagram shows a right-angled triangle, \(P Q R\).
Calculate angle \(Q R P\).

\(
\text { Angle } Q R P=
\)
